website_summaries.verdict: A basic fabric shin guard for versatile use that gets the job done.
pros: Not just for athletic wear, this shin guard works for health problems, jobs where ankle-to-knee protection is needed – and for the generally clumsy human
Also well liked for martial arts
Fits snugly and very comfortable to wear
Easy to slip on and off
cons: No hard shell protection and some reviewers find the soft padding not adequate for high impact sports

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I practice Tae Kwon Do and got sick of colliding shins while sparring. I finally decided to get shin guards. I ordered standard Century ones but found them to be way too clunky and thick. These ones are perfect though. Quick to get on and fit snuggly. Not overly thick, lightweight. Fits nicely with my sparring gear feet. I don't feel held back or restrained by them. I am 5'4 and ordered the adult small.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: We play Football not Soccer and these take it all and Wash easy.
customer_reviews.text: My husband is tall, 46 years old, and still plays soccer! I can not tell you how badly designed normal soccer shin guards are and as your children grow they seem to want your 6ft4 teen to wear a stupid small 6 inch piece of garbage. These cover the full front of the leg from the ankle to the knee as shown. I also want you to understand my Mum is English, we play Football year round, not Soccer. The end of games clothes are torn, and my husband has done a lot of damage over the years but these things take it all and then go right in the washer. I do air dry them.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel De' foe

customer_reviews.title: Fit is important
customer_reviews.text: The protection of this guard is adequate... However, this products size evidently varies in length only. I purchased a large. The length was fine, but the circumference does not increase with an increase in size...ie M to L to XL. This information was not prominently posted and as a result, the guards are far too tight around my 16” calf. I would not recommend this item to anyone with more than a 15” calf....and if the previous post is correct about length being the only variable, I would not recommend the XL either for the same reason
customer_reviews.author: pastorlindas

customer_reviews.title: Great for weedeating
customer_reviews.text: Im 6ft 1’ and these x-large shin guards are perfect for my size. I was looking for something comfortable to weedeat in and I am in full time lawn care these work great for that. They are super comfortable and you just slip them on like socks. I’ve only used them for a week so not sure of the long jevity of them but so far so good!!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Not for sports...but for health!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a reason that you might not expect. I’m 84 y/o and I recently had radiation and surgery for skin cancer on my shin. It has healed, thankfully, but has left my shin very sensitive and I have a need to protect it from any scrape or injury. These pads work great ... not too heavy and comfortable to wear when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Anne OConnor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for shin protection....
customer_reviews.text: So far these guards are PERFECT. The purchase was for my husband. He has injured his shin twice now, delivering Heavy Steel products. These guards are the perfect fit. Comfortable , lightweight, just dense enough to provide the protection that is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Beba

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: These are great to avoid injuries during Muay Thai type kicks and blocks. The padding is best suited for light to medium force sparring and kicks to a bag. I use them under my sweat pants. They obviously don't protect the feet, but because there aren't any straps to hold down a foot section, you wont slip and fall as often on the mat. They also wash and dry well without shrinkage or warping.
customer_reviews.author: Wineguy

customer_reviews.title: protection for my lower legs
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to protect my husband's lower legs when he mows as he is diabetic. We have a lot of bushes and vines that scratch his legs up pretty bad. This has solved the problem. His calves are rather large due to some edema. These fit perfectly and are easy to get on and off. He says they do make his legs sweat a little but he is okay with that.
customer_reviews.author: Animal lover

customer_reviews.title: Expect these to be too small for the typical leg/calf unless the wearer is anorexic.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot give an honest appraisal on this produce as after I recieved these and tried to put them on (I need them to protect several recent surgery sites on both legs) but they certainly AREN'T large enough to qualify as "X-Large" unless this size qualifies as sufficient for a chubby kid. I'll need to modify them with, perhaps, some velcro then split the present elastic to allow proper fitment. That or sew in pockets to my jean pant legs to slide them in. The product itself LOOKS to be well made and of quality materials but time will tell after I modify them.Oh, well. Live and learn and buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Huggy

customer_reviews.title: Need size chart for these
customer_reviews.text: These are of good quality, but I had to guess at the size since there was no size chart given and because of this I only gave 3 stars. These could have been longer in length and I'm only 5' tall. I ordered the "small". Thought maybe I could have order the child large, but without a size chart with measurements you really didn't know what you were getting. They need to put a size chart with this including length with each size and calf measurement.
customer_reviews.author: reba

customer_reviews.title: Good for light use but not for mountain biking
customer_reviews.text: I bought it mainly for protecting my shin from pedal strike while I learn mountain biking. The size fits well according to chart. Took it for a trail ride, it protected my shin ok but clothes material of the guard attracted all kinds of seed and thorn sticking on it. I needed to pick it out one by one. I have already seen some thread came out, so I do think it will last long. Also it is a bit hot to wear outdoor in summer time. This shin guard will be more suitable for some indoor activity. For the price of 12.99, I think it is good value for its intended use.
customer_reviews.author: H. Ho

customer_reviews.title: Wood splitting?
customer_reviews.text: For some reason when I am splitting wood for the winter, the pieces are falling to the ground and guess what... my poor shins take a beating. Came in one day after splitting wood and looked like I had been in a fight with a 2 year old wielding a machete. I'm really hoping these will save them. Will be wearing them under a pair of overalls so I'm expecting good things. Well made but don't expect hard shell protection. If I need more help I'll probably buy a pair of baseball or hockey shin guards. Hope fully these will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Paulsbud

customer_reviews.title: Bought ProForce Shin guards but was shipped a different brand
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to play ladies senior softball at recommendation of another teammate. She bought hers at Academy, but they were out. Wrote down name and size from looking at her shin guards, but what I received today was a totally different brand doesn't say ProForce on the tag like hers do. The bag doesn't say Proforce anywhere but a sticker that is added to the bag, The card board attached to the bag says CHS the same as the shin guards themselves. Feel like I was deceived and got a lesser product.
customer_reviews.author: melissa kirchem

customer_reviews.title: I could hardly tell I had them on
customer_reviews.text: Like many I have no meat on my chins. My legs are all tore up from banging them on stuff. Heck, I just to look at the corner of a piece of furniture and I get a a chin wound. These guards are great for doing work around the home, garage, and possibly at work. I also find I'm much more aware of my surroundings. There comfortable to ware and cool on the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Cyril and Jan

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty good if you need shin protection
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good if you need shin protection, students hate kicking me in the shins, hurts them more than me. But with these on I can teach technique without them being afraid to strike me. I think they run a little small at 5'7 I got the large and they are a little tight, which is ok. Some of the larger guys would have a problem getting into these.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas James

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I’m 6’3” and 220 pounds and the x-large fit me perfectly. Even though I coached youth soccer for many years I actually bought these for my motorcycle! I have an air cooled 1,800cc Victory Vision and I live near Tucson, AZ. The engine is unbearably hot during the summer so I put on these shin guards and turn the front padded part towards the engine. Totally solved my heat issue and I don’t feel the heat anymore at all. Great product! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: T. Dore

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, stay-put guards.
customer_reviews.text: I am at an age where bad sight and clumsiness means I run into stuff. My shins looked like a battlefield and bruises that used to heal in days lasted weeks. These guards are comfortable for all day wear, easy on and off, wash well, and have returned my shins to that of just an old man, rather than a clumsy old man.
customer_reviews.author: Not-the-Momma

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I did not buy these for use in sports, but instead as shin protection at work, so I cannot comment on how they would perform on a soccer field or elsewhere. They are of a fairly thick and soft foam rubber that is enclosed in a stretchy stocking material. For me--an adult male--they are comfortable, fit snugly, and perform well overall. I have not had them long, and so this is an initial product ownership review.
customer_reviews.author: consumer vet

customer_reviews.title: Work great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for my husband to protect his legs from bumping into hard things at work. They work great for that. So far not too uncomfortable at winter time. Maybe hot in summer. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: V.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great as diabetic leg protection
customer_reviews.text: Works great for diabetic leg protection. Husband is diabetic and prone to leg ulcers. But he likes to ware shorts. ( he has 1 prosthetic leg and shorts are easier ) Any little bump or scrape on his leg can become a ulcer. These protect him while still being comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kittalla

customer_reviews.title: nice protection
customer_reviews.text: I work with goats and I'm always getting hurt. I use these when I catch the little ones for worming and working on hooves. Those little guys can jump up and rake their hind feet right down my legs. I do turn them around backwards when I wear them to protect the backs of my legs. Works great for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Very comftrouble and a nice fit. I work construction and it has protected ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comftrouble and a nice fit. I work construction and it has protected me from many shin injuries. It paid itself a couple of times already.
customer_reviews.author: Cee Rivra

customer_reviews.title: OKAY FOR DEADLIFTS AND FOR A STEAL PRICE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for deadlifts, it protects my shins BUT it does create a bit of friction which can hinder you deadlift making it harder. But I will give it this, compared to other products this one is a total steal for its price!!! So if you want to protect your shins on your deadlift and don't want to pay a lot of money to do so, GET THIS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Witt

customer_reviews.title: Itch alot but good purpose tho
customer_reviews.text: I work in the warehouse where i hit my shin with boxes carts etc i hate it!! This works fantastic however is controlled temperature 30°to -10° works fine but in hot temperature i dont think you gonna like it
customer_reviews.author: carlos

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR ME
customer_reviews.text: I'M AN OLD GArdener in tropical florida always pruning thorny bushes and banging my shins up against unseen stumps,etc. and these guards are great
customer_reviews.author: ann muss

customer_reviews.title: Great protection. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Got for my husband he does a lot of building and wood working projects as well as yard work. Perfect for what he needs to protect his shins he would often bang them up working outside. These are perfect for his daily use. Got the largest size my husband is 6 feet and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperBuzz80

customer_reviews.title: Real shin savers
customer_reviews.text: My husband was constantly barking his shins and has had repeated leg infections from the wounds, these have stopped the injuries. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked beyond our expectations
customer_reviews.text: Amidst all of this Covid-19 going on, my wife was diagnosed with a brain aneurism Issue and had to have immediate surgery. After surgery, the blood thinner caused her to bruise and bleed easily. Keeping our grandchildren resulted in small bumps from the grandchildren turning into bloody black places on her legs. I did not have the luxury of running around town to find something to protect her legs. I searched Amazon for some kind of soft shin protectors and found this one. We got it on the day we kept 3 toddlers and she immediately put them on. Result was no bruising or bleeding!!!!
customer_reviews.author: weSouthpaw

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and secure feeling. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for what I needed. My boots for adventure motorcycle riding sometimes didn't protect my shuns. Bought these and not only are they comfortable, they stay in place and have a great feel, warm and very non intrusive. Just a secure comfort feel. Yeah, I am very happy with them. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Bob R

customer_reviews.title: comfy but not super protective
customer_reviews.text: i was excited to use these since they're not as hard and bulky as other shinguards, but it only protects against minor bumps and hits. i used these while skateboarding to protect my shins against slams, but was still in pain if the board hit my shins even with these on. i will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used for softball! Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to protect my shins from softball!! I stopped fearing grounders as much, lol! It's not 100% pain-free when I get hit, but close! That is, until the ball bounced up and hit me in the chest!!! That was gnarly. I need one for my chest. At least the ball missed my face... Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: C.T.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and nice padding
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased these to protect my legs while I do yard work. The weed eater string has cut my legs deep but these help block the string when it breaks. Probably not what they were meant for but they were perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: naytive

customer_reviews.title: Excellent protection!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a tool/equipment rental department, and there are many things there that bang against the shins. I have tender skin, and any touch against my pants causes an abrasion. Since I started wearing these shin guards, I have had absolutely no abrasions on my shins, plus they also act as compression socks to help me feel more comfortable being on my feet all day long. I thought they would feel too hot, but so far I barely notice them during the work day.
customer_reviews.author: JustOneMore

customer_reviews.title: A great way to protect your shins
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shin guards to protect my shins when I am splitting firewood. It seems that every time I am working with firewood an errant billet of firewood hits my shins and breaks the skin. These shin guards have solved that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've needed these for a very long time!
customer_reviews.text: My shins are embarrassing and these are preventing them from getting worse. Besides protecting my shins, these provide a little compression and are comfortable. As with anything covering a body part, they can get a little warm which is great in the winter and not so great in the summer but the benefits outweigh that. I wish I had found them long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory J. Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Work great.
customer_reviews.text: We use these out in the woods to protect from branches and thorny plants, and they do exactly that. I only gave a 4 for comfort because they stay pretty tight at the tops, and still make lines in my legs, even after dozens of times wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: GERRY

customer_reviews.title: Shin-saver.
customer_reviews.text: Sustained a large knot and bruise from a softball on my shin. Used the guard to protect the area while healing which allowed me to keep playing. Tapered slip-on design keeps these guards in place.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for me
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for me. I literally got hit in the shins during a softball game with these on and i didn't feel anything. They stay on great too, just pay attention to the sizing! Wish I had ordered these sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product with an even better price.
customer_reviews.text: I seem to be prone to shin injuries, so I ordered these for protection. they are thick - yet lightweight - and protect the shins without discomfort. What more can I say except I am satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Victor O.

customer_reviews.title: Good Protection for Elderly
customer_reviews.text: Bought for elderly person with fragile skin and frequent skin tears on shins. Easy to get on and off (bought children's size for 95 lb person). Guard itself is soft but sturdy (not hard plastic), stretchy in back so easy to get on and off. Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: MiamiMom

customer_reviews.title: Best investment to keep from shin injuries
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my elderly mother.. she was hitting her legs on numerous items causing wound problems. She needed to protect her shins with something. I put these on her and they work perfectly. Not too thick to wear under her blue jeans but thick enough to keep her from more harm. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: 3isanuff

customer_reviews.title: good protection for basic practice -->  !washable!
customer_reviews.text: I do Krav Maga. I wear these basically all the time. It's a good enough Shin protection for "overall" training. Best thing about them is that they're light and totally washable. I've been using them and washing them for 4 months now. they get a bit woolly but I think I can still use them until the end of the semester. I would recommend using something stronger and also protecting the feet and lower knee if you know you'll be training the kicks!
customer_reviews.author: Elo

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I should have ordered these years ago. Easy to put on, comfortable and save my legs while wearing shorts and edging my driveway (spring, summer and fall in Florida). Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: These are very durable and breathe well. We have ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very durable and breathe well. We have had no issues with the quality. My only frustration has been when they remove the guards. It does tend to stick to sweaty skin making it difficult for our boys to pull them off
customer_reviews.author: Chad Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shin guards a month or so only used them maybe 3xs . . . do they protect your shins yes . . . but they are not made well . . . they are starting to fray at the top and the elastic is coming out!! Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective Light Protection
customer_reviews.text: These are hardly noticeable on your shins, but will protect you from banging up your shins when moving objects or in my case doing stage work.
customer_reviews.author: Roy J. Rossi

customer_reviews.title: does what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: cheap and does what it supposed to. I use them to protect my shins when I deadlift. no more scraped up shins. When they get too gross, you can throw them in the washing machine easily.
customer_reviews.author: R. P.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort fitting
customer_reviews.text: I use it on bare skin cutting grass, moving large junk object to protect my shin and it work great. East to put on with velcro strap.
customer_reviews.author: Island-dude

customer_reviews.title: These were used by my wife who was on blood ...
customer_reviews.text: These were used by my wife who was on blood thinners and was always bumping into things and bled profusely. These incidents were greatly diminished when using these shin guards
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Bought to protect my shins while splitting wood. They help if a log rolls off or kicks out. No more bruised legs.
customer_reviews.author: Ladycat

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something easy to slip on that would protect my legs from injury. My multiple myeloma causes my skin to be like tissue paper. Really bad scrapes and small puncture wounds will send me to the wound center in a heartbeat!! These will protect me and allow me to do the outside and inside work that I love doing. They are soft and not real tight...causing no excess pressure on my legs. Wonderful product and well made.
customer_reviews.author: virginia

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort with safety
customer_reviews.text: I have thin skin and these make going out to play with my dog or long outings much safer. So light weight I hardly know they are on.
customer_reviews.author: candy downs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect protection for sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: I have very sensitive skin, and these work perfectly for me. I have had so many scrapes from bike riding until I started to wear these!
customer_reviews.author: Candio

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for what I bought them for
customer_reviews.text: I bought to wear as shin guards while running barrels. They are nice and light and fit under jeans but the first time I hit a barrel it sliced right through the padding and still tore my leg up....and it is a pretty decent layer of padding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These were great my husband loved them. They did irritate him a bit since he had them on for about 12 hours but it helps to put on something underneath like some long tube socks.
customer_reviews.author: susie

customer_reviews.title: Do what they are designed for
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’5, 128lb and ordered medium. They fit fine and are exactly what I was looking for to protect my shins during in class sparring.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hull

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought them to keep my shins protected and warm during the winter when splitting wood and they have been well worth the price; stopped shin bruises and were warm even with temps in the teens. Highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Ken E

customer_reviews.title: Protect yourself from banging your legs
customer_reviews.text: Because have diabetes and I am active I need to protect my legs from getting hurt working and playing and these really help.
customer_reviews.author: william perschall

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has Parkinson’s and falls often. I purchased these shin guards for his protection. They are well made, thickly padded, and comfortable. He wears them all day everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Parra

customer_reviews.title: The perfect fit in a shin guard
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shin guards because I was being kicked in the shins during some Tae Kwon Do tournaments. These shin guards slip on relatively easily and have protected my shins from stray low kicks. Prior to using these shin guards, I was having substantial bruising and swelling of my shins after being kicked in the shin. Since then, the impact has been lessened greatly, with no bruising or swelling. I highly recommend this product for anyone who needs extra protection of their shins.
customer_reviews.author: TL Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 10 year old to practice fast pitch ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 10 year old to practice fast pitch ball. Has built her confidence not being dinged in the shin.
customer_reviews.author: MELISSA HINSON

customer_reviews.title: I like them but wish they were available either bigger in ...
customer_reviews.text: I like them but wish they were available either bigger in size (my legs swell very badly) or have velcro to make them tighter or looser. Other than that - they are good.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shin Guards
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shin guards. I use them for bmx flatland and they offer plenty of protection, comfort, and fit under pants. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: FlatlandRob

customer_reviews.title: If you are old & do karate - get some
customer_reviews.text: If you are old (like 74) & the skin on your shins is thin & tears easily & you do karate then get these and & do fearless shin blocks like a teenager - totally pleased with this product
customer_reviews.author: Russell Holder

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, would be better if the outside material had a layer with more grip though. But overall im mostly satisfied & this was the best option i could find.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great product specially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Work great for blocking rocks from weedeater. I have lawn care business and use these shin gaurds when weedeating and they work great protecting my legs so i can where shorts.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Shelton

customer_reviews.title: They are super comfortable and very effective
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these for a year when I climb on truss as an audio technician to protect my knees and shins from bruises. They are super comfortable and very effective. I just wore my first pair out and have bought another for the next tour.
customer_reviews.author: Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Save my shins!
customer_reviews.text: I am a type II diabetic and still work on a ladder from time to time. My shins were a mess; bruises and scabs. This has protected them. They are easy to slide on, but difficult to get off. I wish they had velcro traps. But, my shins are protected well.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Vernon

customer_reviews.title: Too tight on my legs
customer_reviews.text: Good protection but I had to stop wearing because my shins were breaking out and getting really itchy. They were too tight on me and I got the biggest size 😕
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Used to protect
customer_reviews.text: Bought extra large and Velcro was a little short to fasten
customer_reviews.author: Janet Kasuboske

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of shinguard. Flexible and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: Nice pair of shinguard, recommended by my kid's karate instructor. Flexible and affordable!
customer_reviews.author: cmbio

customer_reviews.title: Fit good
customer_reviews.text: So far very good fit and quality. work food for protecting shins from bumping and hitting shins when at work.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Good deal.
customer_reviews.text: My hubby loves them for chores that risk injury to his shins and calves.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M. Byrne

customer_reviews.title: ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: I have a problem of bending down when trying to use these. (bad back) it would have been nice if these had zippers. Otherwise a sodid product. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: dean

customer_reviews.title: Prevents aggravating scrapes
customer_reviews.text: Helpful in preventing accidental bruising and scrapes during heavy yard work.
customer_reviews.author: ditchwitch

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Fast delivery. My wife is a slow pitch pitcher and got these to wear under her pants. Work great.
customer_reviews.author: David Clark

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: My shins like them and so do I. there great on a ladder !!
customer_reviews.author: James N H

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to pad my shins during leg presses. I took off one star because I wish the padding was just a little thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Grizz

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, protection, and fit!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for martial arts and they are perfect. I picture them being great for soccer too. They are better than any of my former shin guards I used in soccer when I played. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: Work well, somewhat tighter than I expected, give the size ordered, but certainly DO stay up and may stretch as time goes on...
customer_reviews.author: Kleine

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: these are a great fit and nice quality. I purchased these for crossfit when doing box jumps since I'm a beginner, but I think I need something more sturdy incase I miss the box. They are soft and cushiony but want a little more protection from a miss.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great pad for tibia
customer_reviews.text: This was worn to protect a broken tibia while wrestling. Worked great and provided good protection
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Soft in the back and harder in the front. Good for people that bruise easily.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: you can run with these on.
customer_reviews.text: these are good, not too bulky light weight, they work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to protect my sons shin during football.. the guards are very flemsy.. not enough cushion for protection
customer_reviews.author: dianna theus

customer_reviews.title: These work!
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what it says it does. Fit was perfect, offers me the protection I was looking for. I bruise easily due to meds I'm on, so these shinguards work very well!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Van Kempen

customer_reviews.title: shin guards
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the shin guards with the Velcro closure and when I opened the box, they were the ones without the Velcro. My patient needed them so I decided not to return them. They served the purpose, and that's all that mattered at the time.
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: Save your shins in comfort!
customer_reviews.text: Guard my legs comfortably. I am 6'2" @ 180 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: BelMac

customer_reviews.title: no more pedal slaps
customer_reviews.text: These are super comfortable and work very well when your pedal comes around and slaps you! For the money this is the next thing you should get (second to a bucket) Great value.
customer_reviews.author: mtndabber

customer_reviews.title: Super protective
customer_reviews.text: Great for weed whacking on hot days when you only want to wear shorts.. keeps my legs clean and painless from flying debris.. great fit.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to take in a backpack till you need them.
customer_reviews.text: A little awkward when I have to bend my knees to sit but great, lightweight, and easy on/off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Medium-weight shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Product was too thick to use as a shin guard around the house
customer_reviews.author: LR Scott

customer_reviews.title: They're fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I'm not a soccer player and I needed something cheap, would probably work well with keeping the bar against your shins during deadlifts or MMA.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Useability
customer_reviews.text: I wer these shin guards everyday to protect my shins from bruises. Comfortable, easy to put on,, easy to wash.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Schreuder

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and fits perfect for my 9 year old. An adult could use these as forearm guards easy.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha B

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. Wished they were little thinner. I just need a light cushioning for hitting my shins on a step ladder at work.
customer_reviews.author: Tonja Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I liked my choice
customer_reviews.text: I was able to pull them on and off like super thick socks, but still felt like they protected good. I was a contractor preparing for knee surgery, and the three weeks I wore these while working left my shins blemish free...my surgeon was pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Keith R Lewis

customer_reviews.title: These are great.  Very protective but with no hard plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for shin protection during outdoor work like gardening and yard maintenance. I haven't had a single shin bruise since I started using them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Use em for deadlift, snatch, cleans, etc.. they are great, and surprisingly durable. SURPRISINGLY DURABLE!
customer_reviews.author: ASCENDER

customer_reviews.title: I use these when I'm splitting firewood to protect my ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these when I'm splitting firewood to protect my shines while using my splinter. Saves my shines every time! No more beat up legs!
customer_reviews.author: R. Conley

product_meta.title: ProForce Shin Guards
product_meta.description: Covers shin area from above the ankle to top of shin. Good for padding injured or sensitive areas.
feature_bullets: Covers ankle to top of shin.
